content: गुरु {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (रु-र्वी) {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [गॄ-कु उच्च <ls>Uṇ. 1. 24.</ls>] <ab>compar.</ab> गरीयस्; <ab>superl.</ab> गरिष्ठ {@--1@} Heavy, weighty (<ab>opp.</ab> लघु); (<ab>fig.</ab> also); तेन धूर्जगतो गुर्वी सचिवेषु निचिक्षिपे <ls>R. 1. 34</ls>; <ls n="R.">3. 35</ls>; <ls n="R.">12. 102</ls>; <ls>Rs. 1. 7.</ls> {@--2@} Great, large, long, extended. {@--3@} Long (in duration or length); आरंभगुर्वी <ls>Bh. 2. 60</ls>; गुरुषु दिवसेष्वेषु गच्छत्सु <ls>Me. 83.</ls> {@--4@} Important, momentous, great; विभवगुरुभिः कृत्यैः <ls>Ś. 4. 18</ls>; स्वार्थात्सतां गुरुतरा प्रणयिक्रियैव <ls>V. 4. 15</ls>; <ls>Ku. 3. 13</ls>, <ls>Bh. 3. 7</ls>; <ls>R. 14. 35.</ls> {@--5@} Arduous, difficult (to bear); कांताविरहगुरुणा शापेन <ls>Me. 1.</ls> {@--6@} Great, excessive, violent, intense; गुरुः प्रहर्षः प्रबभूव नात्मनि <ls>R. 3. 17</ls>; गुर्वपि विरहदुःखं <ls>Ś. 4. 15</ls>; <ls>Bg. 6. 22.</ls> {@--7@} Venerable, respectable. {@--8@} Heavy, hard of digestion (as food). {@--9@} Best, excellent. {@--10@} Dear, beloved. {@--11@} Haughty, proud (as a speech). {@--12@} (In prosody) Long, as a syllable, either in itself, or being short, followed by a conjunct consonant &c.; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} ई in ईड् or त in तस्कर. (It is usually represented by ग in works on prosody; मात्तौ गौ चेच्छालिनी वेदलोकैः &c.). {@--13@} Irresistible, unassailable; <ls>Māl. 6. 1.</ls> {@--14@} Mighty, powerful. {@--15@} Valuable, highly prized. {@--16@} Grievous. --रुः {@--1@} ({%a%}) A father; न केवलं तद्गुरुरेकपार्थिवः क्षितावभूदेकधनुर्धरोऽपि सः <ls>R. 3. 31</ls>, <ls n="R. 3.">48</ls>; <ls n="R.">4. 1</ls>; <ls n="R.">8. 29.</ls> ({%b%}) Forefather, ancestor; <ls>U. 5. 28.</ls> {@--2@} Any venerable or respectable person, an elderly personage or relative, the elders (<ab>pl.</ab>) शुश्रूषस्व गुरून् <ls>Ś. 4. 17</ls>; <ls>Bg. 2. 5</ls>; <ls>Bv. 2. 7</ls>, <ls n="Bv. 2.">18</ls>, <ls n="Bv. 2.">19</ls>, <ls n="Bv. 2.">49</ls>; आज्ञा गुरूणां ह्यविचारणीया <ls>R. 14. 46.</ls> {@--3@} A teacher, preceptor; गुरुशिष्यौ. {@--4@} Particularly, a religious teacher, spiritual preceptor; तौ गुरुर्गुरुपत्नी च प्रीत्या प्रतिननंदतुः <ls>R. 1. 57</ls>; (technically a {%Guru%} is one who performs the purificatory ceremonies over a boy and instructs him in the Vedas; स गुरुर्यः क्रियाः कृत्वा वेदमस्मै प्रयच्छति <ls>Y. 1. 34</ls>). {@--5@} A lord, head, superintendent, ruler; वर्णाश्रमाणां गुरवे स वर्णी <ls>R. 5. 19</ls> the head of the castes or orders; गुरुर्नृपाणां गुरवे निवेद्य <ls n="R.">2. 68</ls>. {@--6@} <ab>N.</ab> of Bṛhaspati, the preceptor of the gods; गुरुं नेत्रसहस्रेण चोदयामास वासवः <ls>Ku. 2. 29</ls>; <ls>Pt. 1. 230.</ls> {@--7@} The planet Jupiter; गुरुकाव्यानुगां बिभ्रच्चांद्रीमभिनभः श्रियं <ls>Śi. 2. 2.</ls> {@--8@} The propounder of a new doctrine. {@--9@} The lunar asterism called पुष्य. {@--10@} <ab>N.</ab> of Droṇa, teacher of the Kauravas and Pāṇḍavas. {@--11@} <ab>N.</ab> of Prabhākara, the leader of a school of the Mīmāṃsakas (called after him Prābhākara). {@--12@} The supreme spirit.
